header.title: Class 29 – Multiple Candle Spells
authors: Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Ceremonial Magic, Candle Magic

central_thesis: Multiple candle spells provide a sophisticated and potent method for achieving complex magical goals by breaking down multifaceted intentions into individual candle factors, utilizing a central 'carrier candle' for energy aggregation and projection, and incorporating diagnostic tarot readings for meticulous design and execution.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces multiple candle spells as a solution for complex or multifactorial magical aims that exceed the capacity of single candle spells. It posits that each candle in a multi-candle setup can be assigned a single spell factor, allowing for greater detail and influence, illustrated by an example of a money spell addressing multiple issues with specific colored candles.

This outlines a 7-step process for designing multiple candle spells, similar to single candle spells but with increased complexity. Key steps include selecting a complex purpose, performing multiple 12-card tarot readings (for topic, effectiveness, and directors/limiters), writing detailed directors and limiters, crafting specific charge verses for each non-carrier candle, and designing the candle layout and carvings based on the overall spell intent and readings.

structure_content.chapter_title: 3. Additional Notes on Multiple Candle Spells
structure_content.summary: This section provides practical considerations and advanced techniques for implementing multiple candle spells. It emphasizes the need for a keyed platter/shield, using long fireplace matches for safety, avoiding gold and silver candles unless stabilized with symbols, drilling holes for bridging sticks, and the ideal characteristics of the carrier candle (white, right-facing eagle symbol). It also introduces S-shaped bridges for directional energy flow in 4-candle layouts.

structure_content.chapter_title: Order of Lighting & Flame Interpretation (Implied from Section 3. Additional Notes)
structure_content.summary: The order of lighting candles is determined by spell design (e.g., elemental sequence, stages of spell, flow lines), with the carrier candle always lit last. The text stresses approaching the spell space clockwise from the East for a 4-candle layout. Flame behavior, such as dampened flames before the carrier candle is lit, serves as diagnostic feedback, indicating potential issues with bridging or focus, while high working flames and outer candles leaning towards the carrier signify proper spell engagement.

structure_content.chapter_title: Taking Down a Multiple Candle Spell (Implied from Section 3. Additional Notes)
structure_content.summary: To conclude a multiple candle spell, a specific verse is used for the carrier candle ('Spell will spin and spell will go, As the first, may it be so.'). After letting candles burn for 3-4 minutes, a 'kill spell' verse is spoken ('To kill the spell and stop it now.'), and candles are snuffed out in the reverse order of lighting, with the carrier candle snuffed first.

structure_content.chapter_title: 4. House Cleaning and Shielding with the Sun Candle
structure_content.summary: This details a specific ritual for clearing baneful energies and establishing psychic shielding in a space using a Sun Yellow (for cleaning) or electric blue (for shielding) candle, potentially with a Sun symbol. The ritual involves standing South facing North, lighting the candle with a wooden/paper match, and reciting specific charge verses. It requires recharging the candle and repeating the process in each room.

This describes an attraction spell utilizing a candle of a color corresponding to the desired outcome (e.g., green for money, sky blue for spiritual enlightenment) and a lodestone or magnet. The magnet is placed at the base of the candle with its pull side facing North. A custom 'come along' verse is recited repeatedly over several days while pushing energies into the environment, with the candle snuffed after each sitting. An alternative uses a Sun candle, directors, limiters, and a specific verse for personal aims.
The document briefly mentions that the 'Walking in My Magical Self' ritual should be used for the Exit Ritual, Day Greetings, and Day Endings for the week.

key_concepts.definition: Magical workings involving two or more candles, typically with a central 'carrier candle,' designed to address complex goals by assigning distinct factors or intentions to individual candles. This allows for greater specificity and power compared to single candle spells.

The central candle in a multiple candle spell responsible for aggregating and launching the collective energy matrix of all other spell candles. It is typically white, taller than the other candles, and carved with the 'right-facing eagle' carrier symbol.
The right-facing eagle symbol, which represents the channeling of one's wishes to the Universe. It is carved on the top third of the carrier candle (or bottom third if the candle is to be reused).

The process of physically connecting the individual spell candles to the carrier candle using small 'wands' or sticks (e.g., toothpicks, small pieces of wood), carved to resemble tiny wands and 'keyed' to ensure proper energy flow between the components of the spell.

Detailed instructions and boundaries defining the intended scope, mechanism, and desired outcome of a magical operation. For multiple candle spells, these can be more complex and are used to inform candle assignments and verse writing.

A specific poetic or rhyming invocation recited to imbue a candle or an entire spell with its magical intention and energy. In multiple candle spells, each non-carrier candle has its own charge verse, while the carrier candle has a distinct launching verse.

Conceptual guidelines for designing the sequence and progression of a spell, specifying its beginning, procedural steps, accomplishments, momentum building, and conclusion. These inform the choice of symbols, candle arrangements, and lighting order.

A metaphorical term used to describe a magical shielding effect that repels or prevents unwanted psychic or energetic influences from affecting a person or space, achieved through specific shielding candle rituals.

A candle, typically yellow (for cleaning) or electric blue (for shielding), which may or may not have a Sun symbol carved on it. Used in specific rituals for clearing negative energies from a space or establishing protective barriers.

A diagnostic tarot or oracle spread used at various stages of spell design—to define the spell's topic, assess its potential effectiveness, evaluate the clarity of directors and limiters, and test the suitability of verses and candle carvings.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined is a comprehensive methodology for designing, executing, and concluding multiple candle spells for complex magical objectives. It emphasizes the decomposition of intricate goals into individual factors, each assigned to a specific candle, with a central carrier candle acting as the energy nexus. The system is heavily reliant on preliminary 12-card tarot readings for diagnostic purposes at various stages of spell design, from initial purpose selection to testing verses and carvings. Bridging mechanisms, specific candle colors, directional lighting, and flame interpretation are integral to the operative phase, while tailored verses are used for charging and conclusion. The system also includes specialized rituals for spatial cleansing, shielding, and attraction (using magnets), demonstrating a versatile application of candle magic principles.
tools: Various colored candles (including specific colors for different factors, white for carrier)
Awl or sharp tool (for drilling holes)
Bridging sticks (small wands, e.g., toothpicks, wood, coat hangers)

relevant_quotes.text: Sometimes single candle spells lack the power or sophistication to achieve certain goal or aim. Multiple candle spells are good in situations where there are many or divergent spell factors.
The carrier candle gathers power and programming from all the other candles and launches the energy matrix.
Always make sure you carve the right facing eagle!
Spell will spin and spell will grow, till all be done and it be so!
Child of wonder, child of flame Cleanse these walls and cleanse this space Far from here send baneful trace 'Til this be done and it be so Thus my will for all to know.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text presents a highly structured and systematic approach to candle magic, moving beyond simple sympathetic acts to a complex system integrating divinatory feedback (12-card readings) and specific energy mechanics (carrier candles, bridging, flow lines). It aligns with modern operative magic's emphasis on detailed planning and diagnostic checks, reminiscent of Chaos Magic's modularity and Hermeticism's focus on precise correspondences and directed will. The concept of 'flow lines' provides a robust framework for magical programming, akin to sigilization or magical scripting. The use of a 'carrier candle' as an energy nexus is a common trope in many magical traditions, here formalized with specific symbols and functions. The document's integration of protective and attraction spells demonstrates a holistic magical practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience is likely practitioners already familiar with foundational candle magic and tarot reading, seeking to advance their spellcraft to handle more complex or nuanced magical objectives. It caters to those who appreciate a methodical, almost scientific, approach to magic, valuing diagnostic feedback and precise execution over spontaneous or intuitive workings. Its technical language and detailed instructions would appeal to students of structured magical curricula, such as the Esoteric School of Shamanism and Magic, or individuals with an academic interest in the mechanics of magical systems.
